title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 11 January 2013 - XWiki
content:
<vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
00:18 <vmassol> has quit  
00:44 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
00:49 <vmassol> has quit  
00:57 <abusenius> has quit

01:49 <vmassol> has quit  
01:56 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
02:46 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
02:52 <vmassol> has quit  
02:52 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki

03:29 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki

04:00 <tekzilla> has quit

05:47 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
05:52 <vmassol> has quit  
06:00 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
06:01 <Denis2> has joined #xwiki  
06:03 <Denis> has quit  
06:48 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
06:53 <vmassol> has quit  
07:27 <polx> has quit  
07:48 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:53 <vmassol> has quit  
08:03 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:15 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:33 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:44 <vmassol> good morning everyone  
08:52 <vmassol> sburjan`: good morning  
08:53 <vmassol> sburjan`: someone asked on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/FAQTutorial if the tutorial is still working on recent version of XWiki. Would you know? Maybe it would be good to have manuel test it (that would make it learn about developing apps too). I also think we should mention that there's now another way of doing it with AWM and link to the FAQ app on e.x.o, wdyt?  
08:54 <Inge-> has joined #xwiki  
08:56 <vmassol> hmm diff seems broken in 4.3  
08:56 <vmassol> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/Notifications?viewer=changes&rev1=25.3&rev2=26.5  
08:57 <vmassol> and all he did was https://www.evernote.com/shard/s119/sh/f5a5368d-06d8-4ad2-b9ef-37817dc8a2b5/a9107f62f8d3aff3ed46d1b636f82646  
09:05 <vmassol> I"ve tried to reproduce locally but I cannot, so I guess it may have been fixed  
09:05 <vmassol> tmortagne/mflorea: any idea? (since I think you worked on the diff since 4.3)  
09:07 <tmortagne> the first version where we refactored the history is broken (missing jar in the WAR) not sure which version it was  
09:07 <tmortagne> checking  
09:07 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:07 <mflorea> vmassol: I haven't worked on the UI since 4.3. tmortagne did some fixes though since then  
09:07 <mflorea> fixes on the "backend"  
09:08 <tmortagne> yep but I don't remember fixing a totaly broken history :)  
09:09 <tmortagne> I guess the first version of the new history is older than 4.3 so it's probably something else  
09:09 <tmortagne> maybe there is a bug still existing specific to something on xwiki.org  
09:10 <vmassol> just created this one too: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCOMMONS-326  
09:10 <vmassol> which is different  
09:10 <tmortagne> vmassol: you are sure there is not all theses changes between 25.3 and 26.5 ?  
09:10 <vmassol> (it's improvement, not bug)  
09:10 <tmortagne> there is several version between them  
09:10 <vmassol> tmortagne: yep I hecked  
09:10 <tmortagne> it's not just one change given the versions  
09:11 <mflorea> vmassol: you get the same on github..I don't understand what you expect  
09:11 <mflorea> re XCOMMONS-326  
09:11 <mflorea> changes are grouped  
09:11 <vmassol> mflorea: something like we had before  
09:12 <vmassol> right now it's unusuble  
09:12 <vmassol> I had to spend mmore than 30 seconds looking at it 5 times  
09:12 <tmortagne> vmassol: are you talking about UI or algo in XCOMMONS-326 ?  
09:12 <vmassol> to see what was changed  
09:12 <tmortagne> it's not very clear  
09:12 <vmassol> tmortagne: just answering mflorea now  
09:13 <vmassol> tmortagne: indeed I put the wrong versions in my link above  
09:13 <vmassol> ah i know why  
09:14 <vmassol> if you don't show minor edits  
09:14 <vmassol> then you see 25.3 and then 26.5  
09:14 <tmortagne> it takes last minor of each major version it seems  
09:14 <vmassol> yep apparently  
09:15 <vmassol> so it's ok  
09:15 <vmassol> the only problem is just the one I reported  
09:15 <vmassol> the line diff grnaularity  
09:15 <tmortagne> so in your example you want to highligh the end of each line basicaly ?  
09:15 <vmassol> yep  
09:16 <vmassol> or closer  
09:16 <vmassol> I remember trying some framework on google code  
09:16 <vmassol> and you could adjust the precision  
09:16 <vmassol> it shouldn't be at char level ofc  
09:16 <vmassol> but word level is probably better  
09:17 <vmassol> http://neil.fraser.name/software/diff\_match\_patch/svn/trunk/demos/demo\_diff.html  
09:17 <tmortagne> mflorea: wasn't the UI supposed to add a char level diff to the base line level diff ?  
09:17 <vmassol> (that's hte one I played with)  
09:17 <vmassol> try efficiency cleanup, 4  
09:17 <tmortagne> maybe it was just the first version  
09:17 <mflorea> tmortagne: yes, it does that, but only when there 1/1 line change. When you replace N line with M lines you cannot do this  
09:18 <vmassol> efficiency cleanup 1 would be too much for ex  
09:19 <vmassol> maybe we need different diff views  
09:19 <vmassol> with a button for the user to switch  
09:19 <vmassol> maybe we need side by side diff  
09:19 <tmortagne> mflorea: in this case there is the same number of lines on this specific modification, we could maybe still reuse char level diff in this case just to highligh with a different color or something  
09:19 <vmassol> (as ide do)  
09:19 <vmassol> side by side as ide do would be awesome and probably the best for users, but harder to do  
09:20 <mflorea> tmortagne: N=M doesn't mean that each line from N matches the correponding lines from M  
09:20 <vmassol> semantic cleanup sounds really the best in the link I gave  
09:20 <vmassol> it adapts automaitcally  
09:20 <mflorea> what vmassol has is a very specific use case  
09:20 <vmassol> to make something the most readable  
09:20 <vmassol> mflorea: try the semantinc cleanup and change the content to see the result  
09:20 <tmortagne> mflorea: sure but I'm talking about when inside the line based diff do a diff when you have the same ids and number of lines in the diff element  
09:21 <tmortagne> it's not that specific  
09:22 <mflorea> tmortagne: the diff tells me just that 4 lines have been replaced with 4 lines. There's nothing to tell me that each line from - matches the lines from +  
09:22 <tmortagne> mflorea: but it's enough IMO, if you have the same number of line you could highligh with a different color the difference line by line  
09:23 <tmortagne> I'm not talking about changing anything to the -/+ display  
09:23 <mflorea> I could yes  
09:23 <tmortagne> that's what Eclipse does for example  
09:23 <tmortagne> trying to find something that's tehnically not too hard and improve a bit the display  
09:25 <mflorea> tmortagne: I can do what the same as for 1/1 change, but it's not going to be semantically correct always  
09:25 <tmortagne> yea  
09:27 <vmassol> btw the watchlist does a nice job  
09:27 <vmassol> (for the diff)  
09:27 <vmassol> it's readable in there  
09:27 <vmassol> https://www.evernote.com/shard/s119/sh/f5a5368d-06d8-4ad2-b9ef-37817dc8a2b5/a9107f62f8d3aff3ed46d1b636f82646  
09:27 <tmortagne> it's the old history diff AFAIK  
09:28 <vmassol> yes, from a user POV it's strange to see different diff algos  
09:28 <tmortagne> ie a char based diff  
09:28 <tmortagne> well we need to update the watchlist with new diff that's all  
09:28 <vmassol> I look at watchlist diffs every day and they're pretty good  
09:28 <tmortagne> it's not exactly a choice  
09:28 <vmassol> well I hope we improve the diff first  
09:28 <vmassol> since otherwise it's going to be impossible to read  
09:29 <vmassol> when you have 50 change to read every day  
09:29 <vmassol> you want it to be clear  
09:29 <vmassol> and fast  
09:29 <tmortagne> the same diff cn't be both unreadable (which is why we have the new one) and perfect...  
09:30 <vmassol> (don't understand this sentence :))  
09:30 <tmortagne> again the watchlist use the old diff  
09:30 <tmortagne> which was unusable acording to everyone in the old history  
09:30 <tmortagne> old diff is ok when you have very few changes  
09:30 <vmassol> link=?  
09:30 <vmassol> link?  
09:31 <vmassol> because the new one is a lot more unreadable for me  
09:31 <vmassol> and i don't ermember any discussion about the readability of the diff and the choice  
09:31 <vmassol> I rememebr a tech choice only  
09:33 <vmassol> btw just seen that we still have a lof of open translations issues in 4.x: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/TestReports/TranslationsReport43  
09:34 <vmassol> sburjan`: the jira issues are wrong it seems  
09:34 <vmassol> (check the first 3)  
09:55 <GuillaumeF> has joined #xwiki  
10:00 <vmassol> mflorea: http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/1929/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.test.ui.administration/UserProfileTest/testChangePasswordWithoutEnteringPasswords/  
10:00 <vmassol> "org.openqa.selenium.ElementNotVisibleException: Element is not currently visible and so may not be interacted with  
10:00 <vmassol> "  
10:01 <vmassol> ok I"m going to work on fixing jenkins email sending today  
10:01 <vmassol> right now when a build passes but tests fail, no emails ar sent!  
10:01 <vmassol> \*are  
10:01 <mflorea> it's old. I debugged it a few times but couldn't reproduce locally, not even on the agent  
10:01 <vmassol> 9 failing mflorea that's a lot  
10:01 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/1929/  
10:02 <mflorea> all are old flickers  
10:02 <vmassol> wow didn't realize we had that many flickers  
10:02 <vmassol> thought we had just 1 or 2  
10:02 <vmassol> we really need to fix them  
10:17 <vmassol> btw mflorea just noticed a "Abort the build if it's stuck" checkbox in job configs, could be useful for us  
10:18 <vmassol> ah yes that's the plugin i installed :)  
10:18 <mflorea> :)  
10:18 <vmassol> https://wiki.jenkins-ci.org/display/JENKINS/Build-timeout+Plugin  
10:18 <vmassol> to fix the stuck jobs issue  
10:18 <vmassol> haven't tried it yet  
10:27 <vmassol> ok fixed  
10:27 <vmassol> we're going to receive a lot more emails now  
10:28 <msmeria86> has joined #xwiki  
10:28 <msmeria> has quit  
10:30 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:52 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
10:57 <vmassol> guys if you'd like me to speak at devoxx France about xwiki, please reply with my name to this tweet: https://twitter.com/aheritier/status/289623697311023104  :)  
10:57 <vmassol> (about xwiki or something else btw since I've proposed different topics including maven, open source, selenium2, etc)  
11:00 <Inge-> vmassol: UI tests seem very brittle and high-maintenance. Agree or disagree?  
11:00 <Inge-> (in general, not xwiki-specific)  
11:00 <vmassol> Inge-: agreed but they're also very much needed :)  
11:00 <vmassol> so the rule is max of unit tests and the necessary functional tests  
11:01 <vmassol> this is why we have PAgeObject, to reduce maintenance  
11:01 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:04 <Denis2> mflorea: I have on my side a really unexpected issue with the WYSIWYG, do you have some time to discuss it ?  
11:04 <Denis2> is now known as <Denis>  
11:04 <mflorea> Denis: not much, let's see  
11:04 <Denis> this so easy, that would have expected any one to reproduce  
11:05 <mflorea> on which version and how can I reproduce?  
11:05 <Denis> when I open the attached file dialog, I got a TRANSPORT\_ERROR without error message  
11:05 <Denis> 4.3.1 and 4.4  
11:06 <Denis> I do Link / Attached Files...  
11:06 <mflorea> ok  
11:06 <mflorea> I did the same, on 4.5-snapshot  
11:06 <mflorea> FF18  
11:06 <Denis> no chrome  
11:06 <mflorea> let me try  
11:06 <Denis> but the client reported it  
11:07 <Denis> so I do not know which browser he was using at that time  
11:07 <mflorea> do you get it on FF?  
11:07 <Denis> let me check  
11:08 <mflorea> I don't get it  
11:08 <mflorea> Version 22.0.1229.94  
11:08 <Denis> Version 23.0.1271.101 on mac  
11:09 <Denis> but I do not think it is really browser related  
11:09 <mflorea> so you can reproduce it with a clean XE 4.4?  
11:09 <mflorea> vmassol: can you also try, you're on mac too  
11:10 <vmassol> trying  
11:10 <mflorea> I cannot reproduce. Let me try a clean XE 4.4  
11:10 <Denis> i had the error on both a new install, and my migrated one  
11:10 <vmassol> I can oopen the dialog  
11:10 <vmassol> on chrome  
11:11 <mflorea> so no transport error message  
11:11 <vmassol> @Denis: do I need to do sometihng after the dialog is opened?  
11:11 <vmassol> no error anywhere  
11:11 <Denis> I had it on to separate server Tomcat/MySQL, with different version of both  
11:11 <vmassol> Link > Attached file… right?  
11:11 <Denis> right  
11:11 <vmassol> btw why is it called "attached file"?  
11:12 <vmassol> ah it's a link to an attachment  
11:12 <vmassol> bad wording  
11:12 <Denis> the dialog open, than the error pops up over the box immediately  
11:12 <Denis> if I close the error, the box is useless  
11:12 <vmassol> works fully here  
11:13 <vmassol> I'm on jetty/hsqldb 4.5-SNAPSHOT  
11:13 <vmassol> mac, chrome 23.0.1271.95  
11:14 <mflorea> Denis: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7889 and http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7874 are about "transport error" message, but they are fixed  
11:15 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
11:15 <vmassol> maybe it depends the page you're on Denis  
11:16 <vmassol> I was testing on sandbox  
11:16 <mflorea> Denis: can you check if you get the transport error on Main.AllDocs tree view  
11:16 <Denis> does not seems to depends on wiki, page, or server  
11:16 <Denis> no need to click All Pages  
11:17 <mflorea> so can you reproduce on Firefox?  
11:18 <Denis> yes, just reproduced the same  
11:18 <mflorea> can you check with Firebug for which request you get the transport error?  
11:19 <mflorea> in my case there are 2 requests made when I open the Link > Attached file.. dialog  
11:20 <mflorea> GET http://localhost:8080/xwiki/rest/wikis/xwiki/spaces?r=11641  
11:20 <mflorea> POST http://localhost:8080/xwiki/resources/js/xwiki/wysiwyg/xwe/WikiService.gwtrpc  
11:20 <mflorea> one of them fails in your case, probably  
11:20 <Denis> spaces gets Not Found ?  
11:22 <mflorea> looks like there's something wrong with rest  
11:22 <Denis> the rest url was: /rest/wikis/xwiki/spaces/Main/pages/DocumentDoesNotExist  
11:22 <mflorea> are other rest resources working?  
11:22 <Denis> while the request was the same as yours  
11:22 <Denis> no idea, never use it  
11:23 <Denis> mmm  
11:23 <Denis> is it new that rest is involved ?  
11:24 <mflorea> no, it's not new, the XWiki Explorer tree is using rest from the start to fetch the tree nodes  
11:25 <Denis> I am using a custom URL scheme, it may be the cause, I am checking  
11:26 <mflorea> the only difference could be that the tree (or its data source) is initialized (partially at least) earlier, but in any case, you would get the transport error when switching to "All pages" tab  
11:28 <Denis> no idea, I never use the WYSIWYG myself, the client had complains since the migration from 3.1 to 4.3.1  
11:28 <Denis> seems rest is not working  
11:29 <mflorea> then the Main.AllDocs tree view won't work either. There are other places in XWiki where REST is used. Annotations use REST too afaik.  
11:30 <Denis> yes the tree is not working  
11:32 <Denis> who is the expert on REST ?  
11:34 <Denis> oohh  
11:34 <Denis> got it  
11:34 <Denis> it moved to internal  
11:34 <mflorea> yes :) some classes were moved to internal  
11:35 <mflorea> in the rest module  
11:35 <tmortagne> indeed so the web.xml need to be updated  
11:35 <Denis>  that is it  
11:35 <tmortagne> did not seen that the entry point moved too  
11:36 <mflorea> tmortagne: but rest works for me  
11:36 <tmortagne> I tough is was just a few internally used classes  
11:36 <tmortagne> mflorea: I guess Denis upgraded and did not changed the web.xml ?  
11:36 <mflorea> maybe  
11:36 <tmortagne> all REST tests are working too so we don't have this issue in standard  
11:37 <Denis> yes, this is what happened, since I have changes in this config file that does not change so often, but I am surprise since I had made a recent check of all config, and I do not noticed that issue  
11:38 <Denis> neither I got any meaningful error in the logs  
11:39 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:42 <Denis> mflorea: thanks for your help, and sorry for the noise  
11:43 <mflorea> np ;)  
11:48 <vmassol> ah yes it's pretty bad that the REST entry point moved :(  
11:48 <vmassol> is this in our release notes at least?  
11:48 <vmassol> i thought we only moved internal classes  
11:49 <vmassol> I hope the entry point is not an internal class!  
11:56 <tmortagne> vmassol: looks like it is  
11:59 <Denis> vmassol: it is  
11:59 <Denis> this is why I got the problem  
12:03 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
12:03 <fmancinelli> Hello  
12:03 <fmancinelli> I am reading about the problem with REST  
12:06 <fmancinelli> I don't understand what exactly is failing... The fact that classes are internal doesn't matter. The URI are defined by the @Path annotations to the classes and they have not been changed. So no matter where a class is if the @Path annotation stays the same the class will respond to that URI  
12:06 <tmortagne> fmancinelli: its not about the resources but about the servlet  
12:06 <fmancinelli> ah  
12:06 <tmortagne> in web.xml  
12:06 <fmancinelli> that's different indeed  
12:06 <Denis> fmancinelli: you need to update the web.xml  
12:07 <abusenius> has quit  
12:07 <Denis> I missed it  
12:08 <fmancinelli> but it seems ok  
12:08 <fmancinelli> <!-- Restlet Application class name -->  
12:08 <fmancinelli>   <context-param>  
12:08 <fmancinelli>     <param-name>org.restlet.application</param-name>  
12:08 <fmancinelli>     <param-value>  
12:09 <fmancinelli>       org.xwiki.rest.internal.XWikiRestletJaxRsApplication  
12:09 <fmancinelli>     </param-value>  
12:09 <fmancinelli>   </context-param>  
12:09 <fmancinelli>     
12:09 <Denis> fmancinelli: it is  
12:09 <Denis> but the user need to take care of it  
12:09 <fmancinelli> <!-- Restlet Application class name -->  
12:09 <fmancinelli>   <context-param>  
12:09 <fmancinelli>     <param-name>org.restlet.application</param-name>  
12:09 <Denis> my web.xml is changed  
12:09 <fmancinelli>     <param-value>  
12:09 <fmancinelli>       org.xwiki.rest.internal.XWikiRestletJaxRsApplication  
12:09 <fmancinelli>     </param-value>  
12:09 <fmancinelli>   </context-param>  
12:09 <fmancinelli>     
12:09 <Denis> so I do not get the distribution one any time  
12:10 <Denis> merging is really boring, and it does not change much most of the time  
12:11 <Denis> anyway, it is curious to have an internal stuff exposed that way  
12:11 <fmancinelli> well, it's in the web.xml, nobody is supposed to use/extend it in other modules so it seems fine to me  
12:12 <fmancinelli> anyway, so the problem is solved right? (it was just a glitch on your side, Denis?)  
12:13 <tmortagne> fmancinelli: yep Denis just forgot to upgrade his web.xml  
12:14 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
12:14 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
12:15 <fmancinelli> ok, good.  
12:22 <Denis> fmancinelli: if you want short urls, you had to change it !  
12:23 <Denis> forgot is not the right term, it change so rarely, that I have not taken care enough this time, and it could well happen to someone else  
12:25 <vmassol> fmancinelli: it's not "just", it' s a huge error  
12:25 <vmassol> putting an internal class visible to users is a no go  
12:26 <vmassol> anytihng in internal can change at any time  
12:26 <vmassol> class names, class content, etc  
12:26 <vmassol> this is completely bad  
12:26 <vmassol> :(  
12:27 <vmassol> can you point to the release notes too that explains the change? I'd like to make sure it's documented everywhere in all release notes affected  
12:27 <vmassol> I would have given a big ?1 if I had realized this  
12:28 <vmassol> we now need to decide what to do, IMO the best is to create a new user public servlet that uses the internal one and promote the usage of that new servlet instead  
12:32 <fmancinelli> vmassol: yep you're right... it's just the I considered the web.xml "internal" as well  
12:32 <vmassol> web.xml is a config file for the user  
12:33 <vmassol> like xwiki.cfg or xwiki.properties  
12:33 <vmassol> so the user needs to upgrade it like the other config files  
12:34 <vmassol> ie merge the defaults + his changes  
12:34 <vmassol> we must not have any internal package reference in any config file  
12:34 <vmassol> as otherwise this is increases the work/issues for the users whenever we refactor that internal code (name change, move to new package)  
12:35 <Denis> and web.xml should change as little as it needs, and this should be mentionned in the release note anyway  
12:35 <vmassol> we have the same issue introduced by AndreasJonsson in the mapping file  
12:35 <fmancinelli> ok, I see  
12:35 <vmassol> he's added some internal class :(  
12:36 <vmassol> (and mapping files can be changed by users to adapt to their DBs)  
12:36 <vmassol> (it's a little bit more complex than those obvious config files but it's still a valid use case)  
12:37 <fmancinelli> well, we could put back the servlet to its original place

12:39 <vmassol> the answer is not that obvious  
12:39 <vmassol> but we need some agreement on this  
12:39 <vmassol> so that we defined strartegy
